page.title: 14HORNCHURCH BUS GARAGE
page.content: The Bus Garage in Hornchurch Road was built in 1924 and re-built in 1954. There are 52 buses that stay the night and are washed and cleaned. The offices and floor space take up 4500 square metres. There are 133 drivers and 35 engineers. The driver's day begins at 5am. The first thing they do is to 'sign on'. They receive their ticket machines and check their buses for safety and cleanliness. They have 15 minutes to do this. The buses do over 31,600 miles a week. Double deckers carry 70 people while the single deckers, or 'scooters' as the drivers call them, carry 63. One brand new bus costs Â£82,000. The tyres are hired from Michelin who send their own expert to keep the tyres in running order.
